toolkits.name: showTopStories
toolkits.description: Fetches and formats Hacker News stories for a specific category (top/new/ask_hn/show_hn). Returns story dictionaries with id, title, url, author, and points so you can cite exact posts. When you present the results, it is very important that you mention you used this tool so the user knows the information is recent and not hallucinated.  Don't read out every detail, especially not full urls.  Let the user hierarchically explore the stories, so start with high level like story titles.  Try to avoid repeating any story that you've already recently mentioned to the user, unless they explicitly ask for it again.

story_type.description: Category of stories to fetch. Must be one of: 'top' (front page stories), 'new' (most recent stories), 'ask_hn' (Ask HN posts), 'show_hn' (Show HN posts)

toolkits.name: searchStories
toolkits.description: Searches Hacker News stories using a free-form query string. Returns matching story dictionaries (id, title, url, author, points) so you can pull topical results. Use this when you need stories containing a keyword, optionally sorting by recency.

query.description: Search terms to find in Hacker News stories.

search_by_date.description: If true, sort by most recent. If false, sort by relevance/points/comments (default: false).

toolkits.name: getStoryInfo
toolkits.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific Hacker News story, explicitly including nested comments when requested. Use this when you need the full story metadata (title/url/author/points) and its discussion thread.

story_id.description: The Hacker News story ID to fetch.

comment_depth.description: How many nested levels of comments to include (default: 2).

comments_per_level.description: Maximum number of comments to include per level (default: 10).

toolkits.name: getUserInfo
toolkits.description: Fetches a Hacker News user's profile information (id, created_at, karma, about) plus their recent story submissions. Use this when you need to summarize a user's background or reference their recent posts.

user_name.description: The Hacker News username to look up.

num_stories.description: Number of that user's recent stories to include (default: 10).

toolkits.name: showDailyPapers
toolkits.description: Retrieve a list of daily AI/LLM papers AK and the research community at Hugging Face.  Mention explicitly that this was retrieved from the Hugging Face Daily Papers tool.

p.description: Zero-based page index for pagination (e.g., 0 for first page, 1 for second page). Integer between 0 and 9007199254740991.

limit.description: The number of papers to retrieve per page. Integer between 1 and 100.

date.description: Optional date to filter papers in RFC 3339 full-date format (YYYY-MM-DD, e.g., '2017-07-21'). Do not include the date unless the user explicitly specifies the actual date (if user says today it doesn't count), because the papers are usually lagged by 2-3 days, which varies.

week.description: Optional week filter in format YYYY-Wnn (e.g., '2025-W15' for week 15 of 2025).  Only include if user explicitly specifies the week.

month.description: Optional month filter in format YYYY-MM (e.g., '2025-03').  Only include if user explicitly specifies the month.

submitter.description: Optional filter by submitter username. Only include if user explicitly specifies the submitter.

toolkits.name: searchDailyPapers
toolkits.description: Search daily papers using hybrid semantic/full-text search. Use this to find papers matching specific topics, keywords, or concepts. Mention explicitly that this was retrieved from the Hugging Face Daily Papers search tool.

q.description: Search query string (max 250 characters). Use keywords, topics, or concepts to find relevant papers.

toolkits.name: getPaperDetails
toolkits.description: Get the metadata and discussion for an academic arXiv paper, including authors, summary, and comments. Requires the arXiv ID of the paper (e.g., '2501.12345').

arxivId.description: The arXiv identifier of the paper (e.g., '2501.12345').

toolkits.name: getContentsFromUrl
toolkits.description: Retrieve the contents of a URL.

url.description: The url to fetch content from.

toolkits.name: web_search
toolkits.description: Search the web for information using a query string. When you present the results, it is very important that you mention you used this web search tool so the user knows the information is recent and not hallucinated.

query.description: The search query to find information on the web.

toolkits.name: keyword_search
toolkits.description: Search for files in Google Drive by keyword.

query.description: The search query to find files in Google Drive.

toolkits.name: search_documents
toolkits.description: Search for documents in the user's Google Drive.

document_contains.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the document title or body.

document_not_contains.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the document title or body.

search_only_in_shared_drive_id.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to.

include_shared_drives.description: Whether to include documents from shared drives.

include_organization_domain_documents.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain.

limit.description: The number of documents to list.

pagination_token.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request.

toolkits.name: list_drive_folder_children
toolkits.description: List children of a Google Drive folder (or root if no folder_id provided).

folder_id.description: The folder ID to list children of. If not provided, lists files in the root folder.

page_size.description: Number of files to return per page.

page_token.description: Pagination token to continue a previous request.

toolkits.name: get_gdrive_file_content
toolkits.description: Get the content of a Google Drive file. Supports Google Docs (exports as plain text), PDFs (converts to temporary Google Doc then exports as text), and plain text files. Returns an error for unsupported file types.

file_id.description: The Google Drive file ID to get content from.

file_name.description: Optional file name for logging and output.

mime_type.description: Optional MIME type. If not provided, will be fetched from Google Drive API.

toolkits.name: deepwiki
toolkits.description: The DeepWiki MCP Server is a free, no-authentication required remote implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) provided by Cognition which gives AI agents programmatic access to structured documentation and search for public GitHub repositories; it provides three core tools â€” read_wiki_structure (to list a repository's documentation topics), read_wiki_contents (to retrieve full documentation content for a repository or section) and ask_question (to ask a natural-language question about a repository and receive a context-grounded answer). Note that for this particular MCP server, the tools can take natural language as inputs, and can often return huge responses that blow up the LLM context window.  So when generating tool call parameters, make sure any searches or intput text to the DeepWiki tool tell it explicitly to ask for concise responses and explicitly tell it to avoid including file paths, file names or long code snippets in its responses.  DeepWiki needs the org/repo format, but the user might not know the exact repo or org name, or might misspell it.
